Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: @IamTrader Komodo doesn't need staking, it's a PoW coin

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <polycryptoblog:matrix.org> Rewards earned through holding in Agama wallet .  Doesn't work on ledger

Author: IamTrader#6042

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: the passive income is automatic, no need to stake. Unfortunately Ledger doesn't support it

Author: IamTrader#6042

Content: in lite mode you only need to save the passphrase, with full mode you download all the blockchain and need to backup the wallet.dat file

Content:
Hey guys can you please vote for KMD's sister coin HUSH to be listed on the https://sonox.io exchnage

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: thanks @pablomp for switching to payments on coinfairvalue!  @jl777c Pablo is the guy behind coinfairvalue and just changed to payments from trx for KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: thanks! It seems the value didnt change much though.

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: Yes the transacted volume also plays a role in the calculation as thats still the same the number did not change much. I can imagine after height 1m we see an increase in daily transacted volume currently its between 2m to 5m kmd / 24 hours

Author: pablomp#1061
Content: You are welcome guys! 🙂 @jl777c @CHMEX

Author: pablomp#1061
Content: Exactly, now the average payment value is lower than it was before, that is why the fair value didn't change so much. But now the metric is closer to the proper one (trade for goods and services), and thus, the fair value should be more accurate.

Author: passcombo.com 🏴☠🍋#0622
Content: @Pablo do you store the FV index (best 1h avg) in some db? might be interesting to try this predictor for price trends as an additional factor, when there will be min 6m history

Author: pablomp#1061
Content: Hello @passcombo.com 🏴☠🍋 Do you mean if I store it in an hourly basis?

Author: pablomp#1061
Content: Currently I am working just with a daily resolution. Nonetheless, the current day data is updated every hour.

Author: passcombo.com 🏴☠🍋#0622
Content: yes storing, should not take too much space, so may be worth storing

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: @ComputerGenie @crumb @webworker01 our marketing team is four man strong. We need the help and support of our community to share and evangelise. Using everyone means I can make sure people see what's happening. If it's a big problem for you then consider disabling notifications.

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: It's much easier to complain than it is to add value. I've used everyone a couple of times in a day at most.

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: And you're right I do sometimes share cross channels... because I want news or votes to be seen. Some people aren't in all channels.

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: thanks @webworker01 - your advice is excellent. It solves the problem for the person who has the problem.

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: You can also mute channels by click the bell icon at the top in discord.

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: So if the 'announcements' channel is too much for you - that's an easy fix.

Author: crumb#2550
Content: keep up the good work! my only "complaint" was posting same stuff into multiple channels. and i am fully aware why you do this. perhaps do announcements and general, when there is an important update

Author: crumb#2550
Content: i was not complaining btw, just expressed my opinion on the issue
